medical_history.chief_complaint: Bilateral upper eyelid retraction due to neonatal Graves' eye disease.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began shortly after birth, with eyelid retraction observed. The patient was treated with methimazole initiated on day 4 of life. The condition has been stable as of the last examination at 16 months of age.
medical_history.family_history: Significant for Graves' disease in the mother (status post-radioactive iodine ablation) and older brother.
